item.title: Kumanjayi Dempsey's family speak out after 'devastating' Tennant Creek death in custody
item.description: The family of a woman who recently died inside an NT police watch house is calling for answers, asking why she wasn't checked by medical staff for nearly two days, and demanding immediate action to improve conditions.

item.title: Noosa houseboats forced off river as new maritime rules take effect
item.description: A David and Goliath battle is playing out on the multi-million-dollar shores of the Noosa River, where dozens of houseboat residents say they are being forced out and potentially into financial ruin.

item.title: Trump suggests he may rein in Minnesota ICE operation amid public outrage
item.description: The Trump administration indicates it could rein in its Minnesota immigration crackdown as public outrage intensifies after a federal agent killed a protester.

item.title: Emergency feed arrives for remote WA pastoralists amid worst drought in decades
item.description: Volunteer truck drivers and farmers rally to deliver tonnes of hay, providing relief for livestock and pastoralists in a remote part of Western Australia quietly struggling with drought.

item.title: Sir Donald Bradman's baggy green fetches record price at auction
item.description: A baggy green cap worn by Don Bradman in the 1947-48 series against India has been sold for $460,000 at auction.

item.title: SA divers have close encounter with great white shark, as local sightings grow
item.description: The sighting comes amid a spate of white shark reports in SA's south east, and after a tragic month of incidents in NSW.

item.title: Emergency warnings for Victorian fires, as heatwave sends temperatures soaring — as it happened
item.description: A record-breaking heatwave is impacting south-east Australia, with temperature records tumbling in parts of Victoria and South Australia.

item.title: Overland Telegraph Line documentary features First Nations accounts of violence
item.description: Aboriginal filmmaker Kieran Satour's documentary tells of murders and massacres by settlers and First Nations people during construction of the Overland Telegraph Line.

item.title: Race to save 'zombie tree' as scientists fight to stop living species from dying out
item.description: Scientists and nursery workers race to save a newly identified tree species in Queensland branded "living dead", after a fungal disease stopped it from growing or reproducing in the wild.

item.title: Another quarterfinal exit for de Minaur as Alcaraz wins in straight sets
item.description: Alex de Minaur has been knocked out of the quarterfinals by world number one Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets.

item.title: How the Perth Scorchers sit alone as Australia's greatest Big Bash League franchise
item.description: Six titles in 15 seasons is an extraordinary record, but what is the secret of the Perth Scorchers' incredible success?

item.title: Rescue dog used in central Queensland koala monitoring program
item.description: This scruffy pup has gone from the pound to being part of a scat detection dog team, helping save endangered koalas.

item.title: Kanye West takes out Wall Street Journal ad to apologise for antisemitism
item.description: Ye, the artist formerly known as Kanye West, has taken out a full-page ad in the Wall Street Journal to apologise for past behaviour, saying he had an undiagnosed brain injury and bipolar disorder.

item.title: Man charged with making explosives after Perth Invasion Day incident
item.description: A 31-year-old man is charged with making explosives in suspicious circumstances after a device was allegedly thrown into a crowd of hundreds of people attending an Invasion Day rally in central Perth yesterday.

item.title: Melbourne boy Danny, 12, missing from Venus Bay beach presumed dead
item.description: A search for a 12-year-old boy missing at a South Gippsland beach has shifted to a recovery operation.

item.title: Maddison and Teagan Levi opt out of NRLW switch to re-sign with Rugby Australia on two-year deal
item.description: Maddison and Teagan Levi have turned down a potential switch to the NRLW and re-signed with Rugby Australia in an effort to claim rugby sevens gold at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.

item.title: The school holidays are over, how's your bedtime routine looking?
item.description: Has your bedtime routine gone out the window over the school holidays? We've got you covered with these expert tips.

item.title: Brandan Koschel denied bail over alleged hate speech at March for Australia rally
item.description: Brandan Koschel has been charged with publicly inciting hatred on the grounds of race causing fear after he made comments at an open mic session at the rally.

item.title: Japan says goodbye to its last pandas as relations with Beijing deteriorate
item.description: The departure of the last pandas from Japan demonstrates a significant crisis in North-East Asian politics that has no resolution on the horizon.

item.title: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins calls to boycott men's World Cup games in US
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of men's World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration.

item.title: Should you leave the air con on for your pets?
item.description: Do you wonder what your pet gets up to at home when you're not there? With temperatures on the rise, we asked three experts about keeping them cool in the heat.

item.title: Sink or Swim | Michael Klim
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Donald Trump triggers a gold rush as investors flee the United States
item.description: While the surging gold price has been a surprise, the driving forces behind it are not. Investors are losing faith in the United States and its role as the standard-bearer for global capitalism.

item.title: Charges withdrawn against seven men accused of illegally trafficking abalone on NSW South Coast
item.description: Seven Aboriginal men from the NSW South Coast, accused of illegally trafficking thousands of blacklip abalone, walk free after police prosecutors withdraw all charges.

item.title: Three families on how they manage multi-generational living
item.description: Cost-of-living and housing affordability issues are bringing generations together under the same roof, but some families are doing it by choice.

item.title: Immigration was at the centre of Donald Trump's 2024 win, but it's now mired in controversy
item.description: If there was one policy area that was at the centre of US President Donald Trump's election win in 2024, it was immigration. But it has now become mired in controversy.

item.title: Bodies of two rock fishermen found off Gerroa 48 hours apart
item.description: A second body has been located during the search for two missing rock fishermen on the South Coast, after police received a missing persons report on Monday.

item.title: Invasion Day 'explosive' device hidden inside Disney Frozen sock, witness says
item.description: A homemade "fragment bomb" thrown into a crowd at a Perth Invasion Day rally yesterday was hidden in a child's sock with a Disney character on it, a woman who picked it up tells the ABC.

item.title: Adelaide man charged with Victor Harbor attempted murder denied bail
item.description: A 20-year-old man remains in an induced coma after being stabbed "no less than 10 times" at a hotel in Victor Harbor, on South Australia's Fleurieu Peninsula. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Two boys rescued from weir amid wild weather in Townsville
item.description: Two boys stranded in white water while fishing at a North Queensland weir are saved in a dramatic rescue by police and swiftwater crews.

item.title: Young driver worked more than 18 hours for Yole harness racing stables before 2023 crash, court hears
item.description: A driver crashed a vehicle towing a horse float after working for more than 18 hours, a Tasmanian court has heard, in a case in which a prominent harness racing stable is accused of failing to comply with its workplace health and safety duty.

item.title: Foreign fishermen enter Queensland island resort before border force intercept
item.description: CCTV captures foreign fishermen landing on a Far North Queensland island resort and asking the bar for refreshments, before their boat is intercepted by the border force.

item.title: Police release images of ute last seen being driven by Lake Cargelligo shooting suspect Julian Ingram
item.description: NSW Police have released images of a white ute which was last seen being driven by Julian Ingram, who is wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of three people in Lake Cargelligo.

item.title: Independent probe on 'missed opportunities' for deadly NZ landslide
item.description: An independent probe will explore whether there was a "missed opportunity" to prevent six deaths caused by a landslide in New Zealand.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Tensions in Minnesota could send the US into another government shutdown — here's why
item.description: Politicians across the spectrum in the US are looking for ways forward as public outrage intensifies in Minnesota. From a border tsar to a partial government shutdown, here's what could come next.

item.title: New South Wales man stands trial on multiple charges for indecently dealing with two WA girls
item.description: The trial of New South Wales man Gregory Carr, accused of indecently dealing with two girls aged 12 and 13, is underway at a West Australian District Court.

item.title: Video shows man throwing explosive device into Perth Invasion Day rally crowd
item.description: WA Police have released CCTV that shows a man, dressed in black and wearing a black face mask, running through the crowd after throwing an object from a shopping centre balcony.

item.title: Anthony Albanese rules out blocking appointment of incoming NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he will not intervene to block the appointment of the NT's incoming administrator, after a series of his past social media posts surfaced in the media.

item.title: Advocate believes system is broken after another death in custody in Kalgoorlie-Boulder
item.description: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch tells the ABC he understands the recent death of a man in police custody in Kalgoorlie-Boulder, 600 kilometres east of Perth, was a "self-harm" issue, but investigations are ongoing.

item.title: Homes feared lost in Otways bushfire amid extreme fire danger in Victoria
item.description: Firefighters have been working through the night to contain a major fire in Victoria's Otway Ranges that was "running hard and fast" after a wind change on Tuesday.

item.title: Coco Gauff calls for greater privacy at Australian Open after racquet smash clip goes viral
item.description: Coco Gauff loses her cool in the tunnels of Melbourne Park, only for it to be broadcast around the world on live TV.

item.title: What is in the EU-India trade deal and what does it mean for global trade?
item.description: The agreement could impact nearly 2 billion people in both economies and comes amid an upheval in global trade stemming from Donald Trump's tariff policies.

item.title: BAFTAs nominations: Rose Byrne, Jacob Elordi lead the Aussie charge
item.description: The Australian hopefuls are nominated in the acting categories, but One Battle After Another leads the field with fourteen nods.

item.title: Trump administration sued by families over deadly Venezuelan boat strike
item.description: Families of two men allege they were murdered in a US missile strike off Venezuela's coast while returning to the Caribbean island nation of Trinidad.

item.title: Hottest 100 of 2025 — how well do you know this year's countdown?
item.description: The Hottest 100 is done for another year. Were you paying attention?

item.title: Why time feels like it speeds up as we age
item.description: The perception that time is flying by can sometimes make us feel stressed and anxious. So how do we slow it down?

item.title: Liberty Bell Bay looks for new use for manganese by-product, after environmental authority intervention
item.description: Liberty Bell Bay is considering how to use a manganese by-product, after concerns were raised by Tasmania's Environment Protection Authority.

item.title: National medicines database promised after telehealth 'doctor-shopping' leads to overdose
item.description: The tragic death of a young Melbourne woman who was stockpiling medication has prompted the federal health minister to move to change the way prescriptions are recorded.

item.title: Police reject claim March for Australia organiser was bashed by Middle Eastern men
item.description: March for Australia claims one of its organisers was bashed by a group of Middle Eastern men the day before Australia Day, but police and an eyewitness account have cast doubt on its claim.

item.title: Albanese government turns defence sights north, completing $355m upgrade to RAAF Base Tindal
item.description: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.

item.title: Australia's heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
item.description: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

item.title: Search for alleged triple murderer Julian Ingram may be like 'finding a needle in a haystack'
item.description: A former deputy commissioner of police who was involved in the eight-year search for one of Australia's most notorious fugitives says finding alleged Lake Cargelligo triple murderer Julian Ingram will be difficult.

item.title: Sydney's landfills are set to reach capacity by 2030 sparking controversial plans to take trash to the regions
item.description: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

item.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
item.description: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

item.title: Fugitive property developer Jean Nassif subject of ICAC probe over former Parramatta council bribe claims
item.description: The New South Wales corruption watchdog is examining allegations fugitive property developer Jean Nassif sought to bribe members of a former Parramatta council.

item.title: Scientists warn microplastics testing could be overestimating extent in human body
item.description: Queensland researchers lead calls for a standardised approach to microplastics testing, amid growing concerns about the impact of the pollutants on the human body.

item.title: Alex de Minaur receives feedback from Carlos Alcaraz after Australian Open loss
item.description: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

item.title: Documents reveal widespread misconduct, complaints, at Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra
item.description: Disturbing allegations of verbal and physical mistreatment of toddlers, poor supervision and repeated staffing failures have emerged in documents about Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka's weird ritual, Carlos Alcaraz shows off — quick hits from the Australian Open
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka discussed why she writes on her coach's head before a match and Alexander Zverev shared an important message. Here are the quick hits from day 10 at the Australian Open.

item.title: Sydney Festival 2026: Our favourite shows from Lacrima to Wake
item.description: A debauched Irish wake, a three-hour French play about a royal wedding dress and British electro-pop band Hot Chip were some of the best of the festival.

item.title: 'Incredibly abnormal' temperatures 20C above average in parts of Australia — as it happened
item.description: Towns in New South Wales and Queensland are sweltering today amid a record-breaking heatwave, as firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes in Victoria.

item.title: Rado Vidisic, A-League title winning coach and Australian football figure, dies aged 64
item.description: Rado Vidosic, a highly-regarded Australian football figure and coach across a number of A-League clubs and teams, dies of cancer aged 64.

item.title: Carlos Alcaraz approaching 'unmatchable' level after mastering powers of concentration
item.description: Twelve months ago, Carlos Alcaraz was outwitted by a hobbled Novak Djokovic. This time around, against a rampaging hometown hero, there would be no slipping up.

item.title: Judge orders ICE head to face court as Trump shakes up Minnesota operation
item.description: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

item.title: Floor collapse at Toll warehouse causes statewide vaccine shortages
item.description: A section of floor has caved-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

item.title: Busselton ratepayers set to foot $60 million bill after performing arts centre cost blowout
item.description: Residents demand answers after the cost of a performing arts centre in the state's South West more than tripled its original allocated budget.

item.title: Meet the 2026 Trailblazers changing regional Australia
item.description: Jayden is helping youth go from feeling "lost, angry and unheard" to "proud strong and seen". He's one of our 2026 Trailblazers, announced today.

item.title: University of Southern Queensland astronomer discovers 'potentially habitable' planet candidate
item.description: An international team of astronomers led from regional Queensland finds an exoplanet 150 light-years away with a 50 per cent chance of having liquid water on its surface.

item.title: TikTok settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial against Meta, YouTube
item.description: TikTok agrees to settle a landmark lawsuit on social media addiction, the same day the trial was due to start against Meta and YouTube.

item.title: Diamonds call up Matilda Garrett for Jamaica series as Australia eyes Commonwealth Games
item.description: Australia's netball hierarchy settles on a replacement for an injured defender ahead of the Diamonds' three-Test series against Jamaica.

item.title: Sinner defeats Shelton to power into another Australian Open semifinal
item.description: Jannik Sinner dominates Ben Shelton after a wounded Novak Djokovic receives a ticket through to the Australian Open semifinals as Lorenzo Musetti withdraws from their quarterfinal injured while leading two sets to love.

item.title: Liberal frontbencher says Morrison's proposal to register imams 'a worthwhile discussion'
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg says Australian Muslims need to take some responsibility for extremist incidents and that a proposal for a register of Islamic preachers is worth considering.

item.title: Tongans frustrated with Trump's 'collective punishment' of foreign nationals
item.description: The United States bars Tongans from short-term visits or travel for tourism and business purposes, saying too many are overstaying their visas.

item.title: Inflation hotter than forecast at end of 2025, adding to rate hike expectations
item.description: Inflation rose at the end of 2025, picking up more than forecast. The Consumer Price Index rose 3.8 per cent annually in December, up from 3.4 per cent in the year to November, adding to rate hike expectations.

item.title: Daylesford crash driver will be compelled to give evidence at inquest, coroner rules
item.description: A Victorian coroner has ruled that a driver with diabetes who ploughed into a crowd outside a regional pub, killing five people, will be compelled to give evidence at an inquest.

item.title: Brisbane house prices set to increase by almost 20 per cent over next two years, KPMG report finds
item.description: Brisbane's property hot run is set to continue, with house prices set to increase by almost 20 per cent over next two years, a KPMG report has found.

item.title: Man charged with hate speech Brandan Koschel had posted photos alongside Neo-Nazis
item.description: Brandan Koschel had posted blurred images of himself standing next to prominent Neo-Nazis on a social media account earlier this month.

item.title: Why haven't police labelled Perth's Invasion Day rally incident terrorism? Here's what we know
item.description: Identifying ideological motivations behind attacks is critical to separating terrorism from other events just designed to cause fear, an extremism expert told the ABC.

item.title: Tony Abbott intervenes in Liberal leadership battle calling on right to unite to oust Sussan Ley
item.description: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has intervened in the Liberal leadership race, urging conservatives to unite behind either Angus Taylor or Andrew Hastie in their bid to oust Sussan Ley from the top job.

item.title: Coco Gauff backed by Iga Świątek after smashing racquet at Australian Open
item.description: Iga Świątek defends Coco Gauff after footage was shown of the American smashing a racquet at the Australian Open.

item.title: Microplastics triple in Sydney's waterways in three years, report finds
item.description: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

item.title: Accidental 'crying horse' toy becomes Spring Festival bestseller in China
item.description: A dour-faced toy horse — the result of a manufacturing error — has gone viral in China, with some workers saying its expression mirrors their long hours and workplace stress.

item.title: Woman accused of paying secret kickbacks to surgeons to use medical devices at Brisbane hospital faces court
item.description: The finance manager is one of four people who were charged last month, following an investigation involving the Crime and Corruption Commission and the Queensland Office of the Health Ombudsman.

item.title: Hoodoo Gurus' Dave Faulkner lashes One Nation use of song at March for Australia Rally
item.description: Faulkner says One Nation and its supporters can "take a running jump" after his band's song was used at an Australia Day rally held by the party, and he's not bothered by party supporters trolling him on social media.

item.title: Cattle farmer rescues koala from bushfire
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Accessory to murder charges dropped in cold case of NSW mother Pauline Sowry
item.description: Leon Boeyen, who has been in prison since May on two charges relating to the 1993 disappearance of the NSW woman, wept as he learned he would be released.

item.title: Tourist mauled by snow leopard while trying to take photo, Chinese media reports
item.description: A female skier has been mauled by a snow leopard on her way back to her hotel in China after she attempted to get a selfie.

item.title: 'Doomsday Clock' set to 85 seconds to midnight, closer than ever to catastrophe
item.description: Atomic scientists set the Doomsday Clock to 85 seconds midnight, with threats such as nuclear weapons and conflicts pushing humanity closer than ever to the point of annihilation.

item.title: Leigh Geoffrey Sushames pleads guilty to murder of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith
item.description: The man accused of fatally shooting Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith pleads guilty to murder in a Devonport court.

item.title: Mass wildlife rescue underway with flying foxes entangled at golf club driving range
item.description: A mass wildlife rescue is again underway at the Noosa Golf Club after dozens of flying foxes became trapped in netting at its driving range for the fourth time this month.

item.title: Why UFC 325 is a collision between Alex Volkanovski's glorious past and uncertain future
item.description: An end of an era looms for Alex Volkanovski as he prepares for his first title defence on home soil, but ahead of UFC 325, Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter is still the nation's gold standard.

item.title: Littleproud open to Ley meeting after Nationals spill resolved
item.description: Nationals Leader David Littleproud will stare down a leadership tilt from Queensland MP Colin Boyce, though colleagues say it is unlikely the challenger will secure enough votes for a spill.

item.title: At least 16 structures lost in Otways fire with heatwave still impacting Victoria's north-east
item.description: At least 16 structures have been destroyed by the Carlisle River fire in Victoria's Otways, with a strong wind change late yesterday afternoon impacting another 1,000 hectares.

item.title: Off-contract Usman Khawaja keen to extend Big Bash career with Brisbane Heat
item.description: In the aftermath of his international retirement, Usman Khawaja is keen to extend his Big Bash career, with his preference to strike a new deal with the Brisbane Heat.

item.title: Wine Australia's export report for 2025 shows consumers sobering up as cost of living bites
item.description: Global demand for Australian wine is continuing to dwindle, with the latest Wine Australia export report showing an 8 per cent decrease in 2025 as consumers opt for alcohol-free trends.

item.title: Teenager accused of electric motorbike death in Perth's north pleads not guilty to manslaughter charge
item.description: A teenage boy accused of killing a 59-year-old woman while riding an unlicensed high-powered electric motorbike in Perth's north has pleaded not guilty to manslaughter.

item.title: 'One-off' literary festival, Constellations, to go ahead in lieu of Writers' Week
item.description: A community literary festival will go ahead in the wake of the cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week, but those involved say it is not a replacement for the original event.

item.description: Counterfeit Botox vials were packaged in branded boxes that appear like a genuine product, according to a renewed warning from the Therapeutic Goods Administration.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana brings rain relief for remote WA inland cattle stations
item.description: Weather associated with a former cyclone has drenched parts of Western Australia's inland region, bringing relief for pastoralists who had received very little rain for the previous 12 months.

item.description: Less than a year after the Reserve Bank started cutting rates, the prospect of a rate rise is a political nightmare for a treasurer hoping for clear air.

item.description: China's ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, questions the Albanese government's ethics in wanting to return the Port of Darwin to Australian hands.

item.description: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of jailed former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol, is sentenced to prison by a Seoul court.

item.title: Former member of National Socialist Network fights for return of weapons licence

item.title: Police say bones found at a Phillip Island house not linked to active missing persons case

item.title: Doctors failed to tell authorities of driver's vision impairment before fatal Adelaide crash, inquest hears

item.description: China's ambassador to Australia says authorities will travel to Brisbane as the search for the man who threw hot coffee on a baby continues.

item.title: Gem hunter receives suspended prison sentence for illegally mining turquoise at NT sacred site
item.description: A gemstone dealer has received a four-month suspended prison sentence for illegally mining more than 8 tonnes of turquoise ore at a Northern Territory sacred site.

item.description: A Victorian man has faced court after allegedly stabbing a man before following him to an Adelaide hospital where he allegedly made threats toward paramedics.

item.description: As he trailed Lorenzo Musetti, 10-time champion Novak Djokovic knew he was on the ropes as he looked to keep his Australian Open campaign alive.

item.description: Tenants are being forced to hand over excessive personal data when applying for rental properties, with new research warning that applicants' personal information could be at risk.

item.title: Trump threatens Iran with 'major destruction' as US fleet arrives in Gulf
item.description: The US president says Tehran should make a deal or face military strikes as tensions between the two countries escalate.

item.title: Australia hits power demand record as renewables pass 50pc milestone
item.description: Amid fits and starts, Australia's energy transition turned a big corner in 2025, as renewables shot past fossil fuels despite demand records.

item.title: 'Bring them home' answered at last as Israel buries final hostage
item.description: Many people who turned out to Ran Gvili's funeral hope this will allow the country to start to move forward and heal.

item.title: Amazon accidentally announces further 16,000 layoffs in AI pivot
item.description: A misfired internal email was the first time many employees found out about a second round of job cuts in just six months.

item.title: Otways bushfire in Victoria eases as heatwave conditions continue in state's north
item.description: Firefighting conditions have improved around the fire that burnt through properties near the town of Gellibrand in Victoria's south-west, but crews warn the blaze is still not under control.

item.title: Line search of river planned for area where Celine Cremer went missing
item.description: Police say forensic testing will be done to determine the identity of the remains, as officers prepare for a further search along a section of the Arthur River.

item.title: Victorian Greens MP Tim Read to retire from state politics to focus on cancer battle
item.description: Victorian Greens MP Tim Read reveals he will retire from politics at this year's election after he was diagnosed with metastatic cancer — but not before one last political fight.

item.title: Back to school quiz: How well did you survive summer with the kids at home?
item.description: We made it. The kids are returning to school. See how much you learned during the most recent, interminable school holiday period with our quiz.

item.title: The US wanted to ban TikTok over national security concerns. Does a deal with China fix that?
item.description: US politicians — both Republican and Democrat — had worried TikTok's Chinese ownership could mean American user data was vulnerable.

item.title: Rate hike pain is on the way for Australian borrowers, but will they be able to tolerate it?
item.description: The Reserve Bank cut interest rates three times last year, betting inflation would moderate. But that hasn't happened, and now a rate hike looks likely next month — and possibly another in May.

item.title: As Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz dominate, straight-sets matches are skyrocketing at the Australian Open
item.description: The gap between the top seeds and the rest of the players in both the men's and women's draws has resulted in another day filled with straight-sets wipeouts at the Australian Open.

item.title: Novak Djokovic disrespected as Serena Williams offers Coco Gauff racquet smashing tips — quick hits from the Australian Open

item.description: The Trump administration is trying to manage a national uproar over Alex Pretti's killing and officials' subsequent comments about the 37-year-old nurse, who they accused of "domestic terrorism".

item.title: These are the sticking points as phase two of the Gaza ceasefire arrives
item.description: The body of the final Israeli hostage has been returned, but uncertainty remains about the future of the strip, including who will oversee its administration, whether Hamas will disarm and the withdrawal of Israeli assets.

item.title: Health courses the most popular area of study for Australian university students in 2026, as IT enrolments fall
item.description: Data from the country's tertiary admissions centres shows health courses are again the most popular area of study for university students in 2026.

item.title: Music rights body says Australian artists are struggling to find streaming audiences at home
item.description: While this year's triple j Hottest 100 featured a significant number of Australian songs, local artists have suffered a shocking decline in online streaming figures over the past five years.

item.title: Missing records in ACT childcare documents prompt concerns about scale of issues in sector
item.description: An ABC investigation has found some parent complaints and incident reports were excluded from a major release of ACT childcare documents, raising concerns about the scale and severity of problems in the sector.

item.title: Patrick Reed joins Brooks Koepka in leaving LIV Golf for PGA Tour return, but faces obstacles
item.description: Patrick Reed, the 2018 Masters champion, announces he is leaving LIV Golf for a return to the PGA Tour.

item.title: Rising bike thefts inconveniencing the nation but police say it's 'opportunistic'
item.description: If it hasn't happened to you, you likely know several people who have had their bikes stolen, and it isn't just those that are worth a lot of money.

item.title: Deputy principal at Catholic school stood down over de facto relationship, inquiry told
item.description: A former deputy principal at a Tasmanian Catholic School tells a parliamentary inquiry he was "treated as though morally compromised" and stood down after revealing he was in a de facto relationship.

item.title: ASX claws back losses from energy and gold, rare earths dumped — as it happened
item.description: An afternoon rally hauled the ASX back from a sharp retreat, but rare earths stocks were punished by a White House broken promise.

item.title: Phoebe Litchfield out of WPL with injury, raising concerns for India multi-format series
item.description: Australian batting star Phoebe Litchfield has to abandon her Women's Premier League season because of injury.

item.title: How locals handle the heat in one of Queensland's hottest towns
item.description: Outback Queenslanders are tough — this is how they handled a 48.5C day.

item.title: 30,000 livestock killed in Victorian bushfires, NSW swelters in extreme heat
item.description: NSW has been on high alert for bushfires as towns across south-eastern Australia continue to swelter in the extreme heat.

item.description: Former aged care workers Marina Lee-Warner and Julie Joy have created a live show tailored to older Australians, including those facing cognitive decline.

item.title: Scuffle between 36ers and Bullets results in seven ejected from NBL game
item.description: Furious Adelaide coach Mike Wells has slammed the "dangerous" actions of two Brisbane imports after a wild scuffle led to seven ejections in the 36ers' blowout NBL win.

item.title: As Trump threatens Iran, a US naval strike group arrives in the Middle East
item.description: A US aircraft carrier, supporting warships, fighter jets and air-defence systems have arrived in the Middle East, as the world waits to see to what action — if any — Donald Trump will take against Iran.

item.title: Talison lithium mine blasts in regional WA ignite calls for home buyback scheme
item.description: Home owners living beside the Greenbushes lithium mine in Western Australia are calling for a buyback or relocation scheme amid the mounting toll of blasting, dust and noise.

item.description: Two cases of the Nipah virus have been detected in India, prompting a raft of screening measures to be enacted in countries across Asia.

item.title: Sophie Molineux named Australian cricket captain, succeeding Alyssa Healy ahead of India series
item.description: Sophie Molineux becomes Australia's new multi-format captain, taking over from Alyssa Healy ahead of a home series against India.

item.title: Firm behind cryptocurrency Qoin fined $14m for 'misleading' and 'condemnable' conduct
item.description: The company behind the Gold Coast-based crypto token Qoin has been fined $14 million by the Federal Court following long-running legal action by the corporate watchdog.

item.title: Man convicted of London assault after Barron Trump witnessed attack on video call from US
item.description: A Russian man who became jealous of a woman's friendship with the youngest son of US President Donald Trump has been found guilty of assaulting her by a London court.

item.title: Canberra woman faces court for allegedly assaulting stranger's newborn baby
item.description: A woman aged in her 50s has faced the ACT Magistrates Court over the incident. WARNING: This story contains distressing details about an alleged assault on a baby.

item.title: Australian Open 2026: Aryna Sabalenka the familar face in women's singles semifinals
item.description: The Australian Open has lost the regular women's grand slam heavyweights from the draw but world number one Aryna Sabalenka remains a Melbourne Park constant.

item.title: First Nations leaders welcome Perth Invasion Day rally terror probe
item.description: First Nations leaders say WA Police's investigation of Monday's alleged Invasion Day rally attack as "a potential terrorist attack" is a step in the right direction.

item.title: Farmers want permanent solution after 200-tonne landslide closes Waterfall Way
item.description: The NSW government has announced a fresh assessment of a key transport route recently closed by a 200-tonne landslip, but residents say it has all been done before.

item.title: Tasmania takes control of ore stockpile after Liberty Bell Bay defaults on $20 million loan
item.description: The Tasmanian government appoints receivers and managers to protect the manganese ore stockpile paid for by taxpayers at the Liberty Bell Bay smelter in the state's north.

item.title: Small plane crashes near Colombia-Venezuela border, killing all 15 on board
item.description: A plane crash in north-east Colombia kills all 15 people on board, including a local lawmaker.

item.title: Live: Svitolina refuses to get photo with Sabalenka before Aus Open semifinal
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka faces off with Elina Svitolina for a spot in the Australian Open final, with Ukraine's Svitolina opting against the traditional pre-match photo alongside her Belarusian opponent. Follow live.

item.title: David Speirs sees 'pathway' to standing for election amid eligibility questions
item.description: Former South Australian Liberal leader David Speirs says there is a way he could stand for the upcoming state election — but is yet to declare whether he will — despite the electoral commission declaring he is ineligible.

item.title: State government's CleanCo pulls out of Moah Creek Wind Farm
item.description: CleanCo says the project does not align with the Queensland Government Energy Roadmap, given changing energy market conditions.

item.title: How the Trump administration plans to control Venezuela's oil money
item.description: Until this week, the Trump administration had provided few details about how involved it would be in Venezuela's governance. New information suggests it will look to hold the purse strings for some time.

item.title: How to see more ABC News stories in Google Search

item.title: Malaysian football executives resign over player naturalisation scandal
item.description: A scandal in which foreign players were improperly granted citizenship to play for the national team leads to the "voluntary" resignation of the executive committee of Malaysian soccer's governing body.

item.title: Why it took nearly half-an-hour for police to start evacuating Perth’s Invasion Day rally
item.description: As police face criticism for their handling of Perth's Invasion Day rally bomb scare, a law enforcement expert says they faced a "no-win situation".

item.title: Former employee accused of defrauding three NSW local councils by more than $1 million
item.description: Martin Thomas Dimec is facing more than 40 charges of fraud after police allege he stole the money from Murrumbidgee, Shoalhaven and Goulburn councils across 12 years of employment.

item.description: An Australian government fund will invest $75 million in Alpha HPA, helping it build the world's largest single manufacturing facility for high-purity aluminium materials.

item.description: The NSW Police commissioner says a surge in domestic violence attacks is a disgrace as police release footage of Julian Ingram, the main suspect wanted over the deadly Lake Cargelligo shooting.

item.title: Coalition chaos drags on ahead of first official sitting week
item.description: Former prime minister John Howard once observed that Pauline Hanson was an "electoral gift to the Labor Party". His words proved relevant this week as the Coalition's chaos dragged on.

item.title: Roland Griffiths handed life sentence for Kylie Sheahan's murder in 2022 house fire
item.description: A Victorian Supreme Court judge sentences Roland James Griffiths to 32 years in prison without parole for the "brutal" murder of wife, 35-year-old Kylie Sheahan.

item.description: The two conservative men vying to replace Sussan Ley as leader of the Liberal Party met in Melbourne before attending a memorial service for their former colleague Katie Allen.

item.description: A United Nations expert is seeking to join a constitutional challenge to the NSW government's protest restrictions brought in after the Bondi terrorist attack.

item.title: Parramatta provided with emails from Zac Lomax's lawyer as contract drama plays out in court
item.description: Parramatta has been given nine emails sent by Zac Lomax's lawyer as the case between the former Eels winger and his former club prepares to hit the courtroom.

item.title: 'Predatory' former Logan teacher jailed for child sex offences
item.description: The former Logan teacher, 30, has been handed a 5-year sentence after pleading guilty to multiple child sex offences.

item.title: UK wants 'sophisticated relationship' with China, Keir Starmer tells Xi Jinping
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer tells Chinese President Xi Jinping he wants to build a "sophisticated relationship" aiming to boost growth and security, signalling a breakthrough in ties after years of acrimony.

item.description: How farmers make sure their livestock — and produce — stay safe during a heatwave.

item.title: Most AI assistants are feminine — and it's fuelling dangerous stereotypes and abuse
item.description: The design choices behind AI technologies — female voices, deferential responses, playful deflections — create a permissive environment for gendered aggression.

item.title: Queensland farm cashing in on US wellness industry demand for camel milk
item.description: Camel milk is in hot demand in the wellness industry, now one Queensland farmer is seizing the moment.

item.title: NSW premier considering extra public holiday in April for Anzac Day
item.description: New South Wales residents could get an extra public holiday in April with Anzac Day falling on a weekend in 2026 and 2027.

item.title: Adelaide man's homemade steam locomotive to haul tourists after 23-year passion build
item.description: After initially waking in a "cold sweat" over the enormity of what he had taken on, Ironbank's Glen Smythe can finally relax after finishing his homemade locomotive — although he still has the boiler to build.

item.title: China executes online scam ringleaders from Myanmar
item.description: China executes 11 people linked to Myanmar criminal gangs, including "key members" involved in online scam operations.

item.title: Planning to breastfeed? Preparation can help you meet your goals
item.description: While most mothers in Australia start breastfeeding, by the time babies are five months old, exclusive breastfeeding drops to 15 per cent. Knowing what to expect — before bub is born — can increase the chances of meeting your breastfeeding goals.

item.description: Seven towers across Melbourne's inner west and south — all designed to house older people — will be redeveloped in the next stage of Victoria's high-rise redevelopment plan.
